head.title: Dining Chez Starck: Organic or Wicked

hedline.hl1: Dining Chez Starck: Organic or Wicked

abstract.p: Bon, new Paris restaurant, serves health-conscious as well as not-so-health-conscious food; photos (S) (Currents)

block.p: This city is a bit slow on the uptake when it comes to some trends -- especially health-conscious food. Philippe Starck took pity and opened his first Parisian restaurant, Bon. Classic steak frites is available, but so is sushi. There is a choice of settings as well: a sushi bar, an intimate dining room with comfy chairs, and a long, communal bar (left). Details like a tabletop lighted from within revealing a starry galaxy (above left) and metallic high stools make it undeniably Starck. The menu also has sections headed ''I Am Bad'' (red meat, sauces), ''Deluxe'' (delicacies like caviar) and ''Mother'' (comfort food). A gift shop stocks Mr. Starck's own organic pasta, his scary leggy juicer and other Starckabilia. Bon is at 25 rue de la Pompe; 011-33-1-40-72-70-00.
